ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Do you think that this participant received the real feedback or the sham feedback treatment?
If you selected REAL FEEDBACK, or SHAM FEEDBACK, why do you think so?: It was ineffective
If you selected REAL FEEDBACK, or SHAM FEEDBACK, why do you think so?: It was effective
If you selected REAL FEEDBACK, or SHAM FEEDBACK, why do you think so?: It caused noticeable adverse events
If you selected REAL FEEDBACK, or SHAM FEEDBACK, why do you think so?: Other (please specify in comments
If you selected REAL FEEDBACK, or SHAM FEEDBACK, how certain are you of your guess in question 1?
Notes: 0 = Not very confident at all; 1 = Somewhat confident; 2 = Pretty confident

ElementDescription: Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data

Notes: 1= subject; 2= parent; 3= clinician; 4= teacher; 5= trainer; 6= fidelity reviewer
1 = Trainer; 2 = Investigator; 3 = Coordinator; 97 = Other Study Staff

ElementDescription: Participant Blinding: On a scale of 1 to 10, how sure is the participant that they received midazolam (1) or ketamine (10)?
Notes: 1= Sure treatment was midazolam; 5= Neutral; 10= Sure treatment was ketamine

ElementDescription: Investigator Blinding: On a scale of 1 to 10, how sure are you that the participant received midazolam (1) or ketamine (10)?
Notes: 1= Sure treatment was midazolam; 5= Neutral; 10= Sure treatment was ketamine
